subject: Management
title: The Opening Line
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Opening Line.

hook.text: A manager rehearsed a tough talk for days. She opened with: we need to talk. He immediately shut down.

buildup.text: How you start a difficult conversation determines whether it's productive or defensive.

discovery.text: Start with observation, not accusation. I noticed X instead of you always do X.

twist.text: The first 30 seconds set the tone for the entire conversation. Get them wrong and nothing works.

climax.text: Try: I'd like to understand your perspective on something. That opens a door, not a fight.

quiz.question: How should you open a difficult conversation?
options: With an observation and curiosity, not an accusation
With a direct statement about what they did wrong
By sending a written summary first to avoid face-to-face tension
